etymology.description: Depicts an eye above a horizontal line, originally representing 'straight' or 'upright.'
etymology.interpretation: The character 直(直) (zhí, 'straight') is a pictogram showing a vertical line beneath an eye at the top, imitating a straight path or direct sightline, symbolizing directness or straightforwardness.

examples.chinese: 她的头发很直(她的頭髮很直)。
飞机从北京直飞(飛機從北京直飛)，到达东京(到達東京)。
examples.pinyin: Fēijī cóng Běijīng zhífēi, dào dá Dōngjīng.
examples.english: The airplane flies directly from Beijing to Tokyo.

examples.chinese: 他直言不讳(他直言不諱)。
